text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan visits the mausoleum of modern Turkey's secular founder Ataturk.
- Islamist-led government increases the government subsidy for ballet and opera by 129 percent for 1997.
- Leading businessman Rahmi Koc says it is obvious that the current coalition does not work and emphasises the need for one party in power.
- Husband massacres ten people in his mother-in-law's house where his wife has been living for two years.
- Police detain 113 members of radical religious group demonstrating in the capital, Ankara.
- Number of holding companies on the rise in Turkey.
- French minister responsible for European relations says Europe's priority is Turkey.
- It is alleged that Turkish staff at Incirlik airbase -- a joint base for the U.S.-led allied airforce that protects Iraqi Kurds -- have found a box full of $10 million worth of U.S. banknotes.
